03070   /**
03071    * Get the next sibling of each element in the QueryPath.
03072    *
03073    * If a selector is provided, the next matching sibling will be returned.
03074    *
03075    * @param string $selector
03076    *  A CSS3 selector.
03077    * @return QueryPath
03078    *  The QueryPath object.
03079    * @see nextAll()
03080    * @see prev()
03081    * @see children()
03082    * @see contents()
03083    * @see parent()
03084    * @see parents()
03085    */
03086   public function next($selector = NULL) {
03087     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03088     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03089       while (isset($m->nextSibling)) {
03090         $m = $m->nextSibling;
03091         if ($m->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
03092           if (!empty($selector)) {
03093             if (qp($m, NULL, $this->options)->is($selector) > 0) {
03094               $found->attach($m);
03095               break;
03096             }
03097           }
03098           else {
03099             $found->attach($m);
03100             break;
03101           }
03102         }
03103       }
03104     }
03105     $this->setMatches($found);
03106     return $this;
03107   }
03108   /**
03109    * Get all siblings after an element.
03110    *
03111    * For each element in the QueryPath, get all siblings that appear after
03112    * it. If a selector is passed in, then only siblings that match the 
03113    * selector will be included.
03114    *
03115    * @param string $selector 
03116    *  A valid CSS 3 selector.
03117    * @return QueryPath
03118    *  The QueryPath object, now containing the matching siblings.
03119    * @see next()
03120    * @see prevAll()
03121    * @see children()
03122    * @see siblings()
03123    */
03124   public function nextAll($selector = NULL) {
03125     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03126     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03127       while (isset($m->nextSibling)) {
03128         $m = $m->nextSibling;
03129         if ($m->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
03130           if (!empty($selector)) {
03131             if (qp($m, NULL, $this->options)->is($selector) > 0) {
03132               $found->attach($m);
03133             }
03134           }
03135           else {
03136             $found->attach($m);
03137           }
03138         }
03139       }
03140     }
03141     $this->setMatches($found);
03142     return $this;
03143   }
03144   /**
03145    * Get the next sibling before each element in the QueryPath.
03146    *
03147    * For each element in the QueryPath, this retrieves the previous sibling
03148    * (if any). If a selector is supplied, it retrieves the first matching 
03149    * sibling (if any is found).
03150    *
03151    * @param string $selector
03152    *  A valid CSS 3 selector.
03153    * @return QueryPath
03154    *  A QueryPath object, now containing any previous siblings that have been 
03155    *  found.
03156    * @see prevAll()
03157    * @see next()
03158    * @see siblings()
03159    * @see children()
03160    */
03161   public function prev($selector = NULL) {
03162     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03163     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03164       while (isset($m->previousSibling)) {
03165         $m = $m->previousSibling;
03166         if ($m->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
03167           if (!empty($selector)) {
03168             if (qp($m, NULL, $this->options)->is($selector)) {
03169               $found->attach($m);
03170               break;
03171             }
03172           }
03173           else {
03174             $found->attach($m);
03175             break;
03176           }
03177         }
03178       }
03179     }
03180     $this->setMatches($found);
03181     return $this;
03182   }
03183   /**
03184    * Get the previous siblings for each element in the QueryPath.
03185    *
03186    * For each element in the QueryPath, get all previous siblings. If a 
03187    * selector is provided, only matching siblings will be retrieved.
03188    *
03189    * @param string $selector
03190    *  A valid CSS 3 selector.
03191    * @return QueryPath
03192    *  The QueryPath object, now wrapping previous sibling elements.
03193    * @see prev()
03194    * @see nextAll()
03195    * @see siblings()
03196    * @see contents()
03197    * @see children()
03198    */
03199   public function prevAll($selector = NULL) {
03200     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03201     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03202       while (isset($m->previousSibling)) {
03203         $m = $m->previousSibling;
03204         if ($m->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
03205           if (!empty($selector)) {
03206             if (qp($m, NULL, $this->options)->is($selector)) {
03207               $found->attach($m);
03208             }
03209           }
03210           else {
03211             $found->attach($m);
03212           }
03213         }
03214       }
03215     }
03216     $this->setMatches($found);
03217     return $this;
03218   }
03219   /**
03220    * @deprecated Use {@link siblings()}.
03221    */
03222   public function peers($selector = NULL) {
03223     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03224     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03225       foreach ($m->parentNode->childNodes as $kid) {
03226         if ($kid->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE && $m !== $kid) {
03227           if (!empty($selector)) {
03228             if (qp($kid, NULL, $this->options)->is($selector)) {
03229               $found->attach($kid);
03230             }
03231           }
03232           else {
03233             $found->attach($kid);
03234           }
03235         }
03236       }
03237     }
03238     $this->setMatches($found);
03239     return $this;
03240   }
03241   /**
03242    * Add a class to all elements in the current QueryPath.
03243    *
03244    * This searchers for a class attribute on each item wrapped by the current 
03245    * QueryPath object. If no attribute is found, a new one is added and its value
03246    * is set to $class. If a class attribute is found, then the value is appended
03247    * on to the end.
03248    *
03249    * @param string $class 
03250    *  The name of the class.
03251    * @return QueryPath
03252    *  Returns the QueryPath object.
03253    * @see css()
03254    * @see attr()
03255    * @see removeClass()
03256    * @see hasClass()
03257    */
03258   public function addClass($class) {
03259     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03260       if ($m->hasAttribute('class')) {
03261         $val = $m->getAttribute('class');
03262         $m->setAttribute('class', $val . ' ' . $class);
03263       }
03264       else {
03265         $m->setAttribute('class', $class);
03266       }
03267     }
03268     return $this;
03269   }
03270   /**
03271    * Remove the named class from any element in the QueryPath that has it.
03272    *
03273    * This may result in the entire class attribute being removed. If there
03274    * are other items in the class attribute, though, they will not be removed.
03275    * 
03276    * Example:
03277    * Consider this XML:
03278    * @code
03279    * <element class="first second"/>
03280    * @endcode
03281    *
03282    * Executing this fragment of code will remove only the 'first' class:
03283    * @code
03284    * qp(document, 'element')->removeClass('first');
03285    * @endcode
03286    *
03287    * The resulting XML will be:
03288    * @code
03289    * <element class="second"/>
03290    * @endcode
03291    *
03292    * To remove the entire 'class' attribute, you should use {@see removeAttr()}.
03293    *
03294    * @param string $class
03295    *  The class name to remove.
03296    * @return QueryPath
03297    *  The modified QueryPath object.
03298    * @see attr()
03299    * @see addClass()
03300    * @see hasClass()
03301    */
03302   public function removeClass($class) {
03303     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03304       if ($m->hasAttribute('class')) {
03305         $vals = explode(' ', $m->getAttribute('class'));
03306         if (in_array($class, $vals)) {
03307           $buf = array();
03308           foreach ($vals as $v) {
03309             if ($v != $class) $buf[] = $v;
03310           }
03311           if (count($buf) == 0)
03312             $m->removeAttribute('class');
03313           else
03314             $m->setAttribute('class', implode(' ', $buf));
03315         }
03316       }
03317     }
03318     return $this;
03319   }
03320   /**
03321    * Returns TRUE if any of the elements in the QueryPath have the specified class.
03322    *
03323    * @param string $class
03324    *  The name of the class.
03325    * @return boolean 
03326    *  TRUE if the class exists in one or more of the elements, FALSE otherwise.
03327    * @see addClass()
03328    * @see removeClass()
03329    */
03330   public function hasClass($class) {
03331     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03332       if ($m->hasAttribute('class')) {
03333         $vals = explode(' ', $m->getAttribute('class'));
03334         if (in_array($class, $vals)) return TRUE;
03335       }
03336     }
03337     return FALSE;
03338   }
03339 
03340   /**
03341    * Branch the base QueryPath into another one with the same matches.
03342    *
03343    * This function makes a copy of the QueryPath object, but keeps the new copy 
03344    * (initially) pointed at the same matches. This object can then be queried without
03345    * changing the original QueryPath. However, changes to the elements inside of this
03346    * QueryPath will show up in the QueryPath from which it is branched.
03347    * 
03348    * Compare this operation with {@link cloneAll()}. The cloneAll() call takes
03349    * the current QueryPath object and makes a copy of all of its matches. You continue
03350    * to operate on the same QueryPath object, but the elements inside of the QueryPath
03351    * are copies of those before the call to cloneAll().
03352    *
03353    * This, on the other hand, copies <i>the QueryPath</i>, but keeps valid 
03354    * references to the document and the wrapped elements. A new query branch is 
03355    * created, but any changes will be written back to the same document.
03356    *
03357    * In practice, this comes in handy when you want to do multiple queries on a part
03358    * of the document, but then return to a previous set of matches. (see {@link QPTPL}
03359    * for examples of this in practice).
03360    *
03361    * Example:
03362    *
03363    * @code
03364    * <?php
03365    * $qp = qp(QueryPath::HTML_STUB);
03366    * $branch = $qp->branch();
03367    * $branch->find('title')->text('Title');
03368    * $qp->find('body')->text('This is the body')->writeHTML;
03369    * ?>
03370    * @endcode
03371    *
03372    * Notice that in the code, each of the QueryPath objects is doing its own 
03373    * query. However, both are modifying the same document. The result of the above 
03374    * would look something like this:
03375    *
03376    * @code
03377    * <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
03378    * <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
03379    * <head>
03380    *    <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"></meta>
03381    *    <title>Title</title>
03382    * </head>
03383    * <body>This is the body</body>
03384    * </html>
03385    * @endcode
03386    *
03387    * Notice that while $qp and $banch were performing separate queries, they 
03388    * both modified the same document.
03389    *
03390    * In jQuery or a browser-based solution, you generally do not need a branching
03391    * function because there is (implicitly) only one document. In QueryPath, there
03392    * is no implicit document. Every document must be explicitly specified (and,
03393    * in most cases, parsed -- which is costly). Branching makes it possible to 
03394    * work on one document with multiple QueryPath objects.
03395    *
03396    * @param string $selector
03397    *  If a selector is passed in, an additional {@link find()} will be executed
03398    *  on the branch before it is returned. (Added in QueryPath 2.0.)
03399    * @return QueryPath
03400    *  A copy of the QueryPath object that points to the same set of elements that
03401    *  the original QueryPath was pointing to.
03402    * @since 1.1
03403    * @see cloneAll()
03404    * @see find()
03405    */
03406   public function branch($selector = NULL) {
03407     $temp = qp($this->matches, NULL, $this->options);
03408     if (isset($selector)) $temp->find($selector);
03409     return $temp;
03410   }
03411   /**
03412    * Perform a deep clone of each node in the QueryPath.
03413    *
03414    * This does not clone the QueryPath object, but instead clones the 
03415    * list of nodes wrapped by the QueryPath. Every element is deeply 
03416    * cloned.
03417    *
03418    * This method is analogous to jQuery's clone() method.
03419    *
03420    * This is a destructive operation, which means that end() will revert
03421    * the list back to the clone's original.
03422    * @see qp()
03423    * @return QueryPath
03424    */
03425   public function cloneAll() {
03426     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03427     foreach ($this->matches as $m) $found->attach($m->cloneNode(TRUE));
03428     $this->setMatches($found, FALSE);
03429     return $this;
03430   }
03431   
03432   /**
03433    * Clone the QueryPath.
03434    *
03435    * This makes a deep clone of the elements inside of the QueryPath.
03436    *
03437    * This clones only the QueryPathImpl, not all of the decorators. The
03438    * clone operator in PHP should handle the cloning of the decorators.
03439    */
03440   public function __clone() {
03441     //XXX: Should we clone the document?
03442     
03443     // Make sure we clone the kids.
03444     $this->cloneAll();
03445   }  
03446 
03447   /**
03448    * Detach any items from the list if they match the selector.
03449    *
03450    * In other words, each item that matches the selector will be remove
03451    * from the DOM document. The returned QueryPath wraps the list of
03452    * removed elements.
03453    *
03454    * If no selector is specified, this will remove all current matches from
03455    * the document.
03456    *
03457    * @param string $selector
03458    *  A CSS Selector.
03459    * @return QueryPath
03460    *  The Query path wrapping a list of removed items.
03461    * @see replaceAll()
03462    * @see replaceWith()
03463    * @see removeChildren()
03464    * @since 2.1
03465    * @author eabrand
03466    */
03467   public function detach($selector = NULL) {
03468 
03469     if(!empty($selector))
03470     $this->find($selector);
03471 
03472     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03473     $this->last = $this->matches;
03474     foreach ($this->matches as $item) {
03475       // The item returned is (according to docs) different from
03476       // the one passed in, so we have to re-store it.
03477       $found->attach($item->parentNode->removeChild($item));
03478     }
03479     $this->setMatches($found);
03480     return $this;
03481   }
03482 
03483   /**
03484    * Attach any items from the list if they match the selector.
03485    *
03486    * If no selector is specified, this will remove all current matches from
03487    * the document.
03488    *
03489    * @param QueryPath $dest
03490    *  A QueryPath Selector.
03491    * @return QueryPath
03492    *  The Query path wrapping a list of removed items.
03493    * @see replaceAll()
03494    * @see replaceWith()
03495    * @see removeChildren()
03496    * @since 2.1
03497    * @author eabrand
03498    */
03499   public function attach(QueryPath $dest) {
03500     foreach ($this->last as $m) $dest->append($m);
03501     return $this;
03502   }
03503   
03504   /**
03505    * Reduce the elements matched by QueryPath to only those which contain the given item.
03506    *
03507    * There are two ways in which this is different from jQuery's implementation:
03508    * - We allow ANY DOMNode, not just DOMElements. That means this will work on 
03509    *   processor instructions, text nodes, comments, etc.
03510    * - Unlike jQuery, this implementation of has() follows QueryPath standard behavior
03511    *   and modifies the existing object. It does not create a brand new object.
03512    * 
03513    * @param mixed $contained
03514    *   - If $contained is a CSS selector (e.g. '#foo'), this will test to see
03515    *     if the current QueryPath has any elements that contain items that match
03516    *     the selector.
03517    *   - If $contained is a DOMNode, then this will test to see if THE EXACT DOMNode
03518    *     exists in the currently matched elements. (Note that you cannot match across DOM trees, even if it is the same document.)
03519    * @since 2.1
03520    * @author eabrand
03521    * @todo It would be trivially easy to add support for iterating over an array or Iterable of DOMNodes.
03522    */
03523   public function has($contained) {
03524     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03525     
03526     // If it's a selector, we just get all of the DOMNodes that match the selector.
03527     $nodes = array();
03528     if (is_string($contained)) {
03529       // Get the list of nodes.
03530       $nodes = $this->branch($contained)->get();
03531     }
03532     elseif ($contained instanceof DOMNode) {
03533       // Make a list with one node.
03534       $nodes = array($contained);
03535     }
03536     
03537     // Now we go through each of the nodes that we are testing. We want to find
03538     // ALL PARENTS that are in our existing QueryPath matches. Those are the
03539     // ones we add to our new matches.
03540     foreach ($nodes as $original_node) {
03541       $node = $original_node;
03542       while (!empty($node)/* && $node != $node->ownerDocument*/) {
03543         if ($this->matches->contains($node)) {
03544           $found->attach($node);
03545         }
03546         $node = $node->parentNode;
03547       }
03548     }
03549     
03550     $this->setMatches($found);
03551     return $this;
03552   }

03554   /**
03555    * Empty everything within the specified element.
03556    *
03557    * A convenience function for removeChildren(). This is equivalent to jQuery's 
03558    * empty() function. However, `empty` is a built-in in PHP, and cannot be used as a 
03559    * function name.
03560    *
03561    * @return QueryPath
03562    *  The QueryPath object with the newly emptied elements.
03563    * @see removeChildren()
03564    * @since 2.1
03565    * @author eabrand
03566    * @deprecated The removeChildren() function is the preferred method.
03567    */
03568   public function emptyElement() {
03569     $this->removeChildren();
03570     return $this;
03571   }

03573   /**
03574    * Get the even elements, so counter-intuitively 1, 3, 5, etc.
03575    *
03576    *
03577    *
03578    * @return QueryPath
03579    *  A QueryPath wrapping all of the children.
03580    * @see removeChildren()
03581    * @see parent()
03582    * @see parents()
03583    * @see next()
03584    * @see prev()
03585    * @since 2.1
03586    * @author eabrand
03587    */
03588   public function even() {
03589     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03590     $even = false;
03591     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03592       if ($even && $m->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE) $found->attach($m);
03593       $even = ($even) ? false : true;
03594     }
03595     $this->setMatches($found);
03596     $this->matches = $found; // Don't buffer this. It is temporary.
03597     return $this;

03615   public function odd() {

03620       $odd = ($odd) ? false : true;

03638   public function first() {

03642         $found->attach($m);
03643         break;
03644       }

03646     $this->setMatches($found);

03651   /**
03652    * Get the first child of the matching element.
03653    *
03654    *
03655    * @return QueryPath
03656    *  A QueryPath wrapping all of the children.
03657    * @see next()
03658    * @see prev()
03659    * @since 2.1
03660    * @author eabrand
03661    */
03662   public function firstChild() {
03663     // Could possibly use $m->firstChild http://theserverpages.com/php/manual/en/ref.dom.php
03664     $found = new SplObjectStorage();

03666     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03667       foreach($m->childNodes as $c) {
03668         if ($c->nodeType == XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
03669           $found->attach($c);
03670           $flag = true;
03671           break;
03672         }
03673       }
03674       if($flag) break;
03675     }
03676     $this->setMatches($found);
03677     $this->matches = $found; // Don't buffer this. It is temporary.
03678     return $this;
03679   }

03681   /**

03718    */
03719   public function lastChild() {

03738   /**
03739    * Get all siblings after an element until the selector is reached.
03740    *
03741    * For each element in the QueryPath, get all siblings that appear after
03742    * it. If a selector is passed in, then only siblings that match the
03743    * selector will be included.
03744    *
03745    * @param string $selector
03746    *  A valid CSS 3 selector.
03747    * @return QueryPath
03748    *  The QueryPath object, now containing the matching siblings.
03749    * @see next()
03750    * @see prevAll()
03751    * @see children()
03752    * @see siblings()
03753    * @since 2.1
03754    * @author eabrand
03755    */
03756   public function nextUntil($selector = NULL) {
03757     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03758     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03759       while (isset($m->nextSibling)) {
03760         $m = $m->nextSibling;
03761         if ($m->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
03762           if (!empty($selector)) {
03763             if (qp($m, NULL, $this->options)->is($selector) > 0) {
03764               break;
03765             }
03766             else {
03767               $found->attach($m);
03768             }
03769           }
03770           else {
03771             $found->attach($m);
03772           }
03773         }
03774       }
03775     }
03776     $this->setMatches($found);
03777     return $this;
03778   } 
03779 
03780   /**
03781    * Get the previous siblings for each element in the QueryPath
03782    * until the selector is reached.
03783    *
03784    * For each element in the QueryPath, get all previous siblings. If a
03785    * selector is provided, only matching siblings will be retrieved.
03786    *
03787    * @param string $selector
03788    *  A valid CSS 3 selector.
03789    * @return QueryPath
03790    *  The QueryPath object, now wrapping previous sibling elements.
03791    * @see prev()
03792    * @see nextAll()
03793    * @see siblings()
03794    * @see contents()
03795    * @see children()
03796    * @since 2.1
03797    * @author eabrand
03798    */
03799   public function prevUntil($selector = NULL) {
03800     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03801     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03802       while (isset($m->previousSibling)) {
03803         $m = $m->previousSibling;
03804         if ($m->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
03805           if (!empty($selector) && qp($m, NULL, $this->options)->is($selector))
03806           break;
03807           else
03808           $found->attach($m);
03809         }
03810       }
03811     }
03812     $this->setMatches($found);
03813     return $this;
03814   }
03815   
03816   /**
03817    * Get all ancestors of each element in the QueryPath until the selector is reached.
03818    *
03819    * If a selector is present, only matching ancestors will be retrieved.
03820    *
03821    * @see parent()
03822    * @param string $selector
03823    *  A valid CSS 3 Selector.
03824    * @return QueryPath
03825    *  A QueryPath object containing the matching ancestors.
03826    * @see siblings()
03827    * @see children()
03828    * @since 2.1
03829    * @author eabrand
03830    */
03831   public function parentsUntil($selector = NULL) {
03832     $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03833     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
03834       while ($m->parentNode->nodeType !== XML_DOCUMENT_NODE) {
03835         $m = $m->parentNode;
03836         // Is there any case where parent node is not an element?
03837         if ($m->nodeType === XML_ELEMENT_NODE) {
03838           if (!empty($selector)) {
03839             if (qp($m, NULL, $this->options)->is($selector) > 0)
03840             break;
03841             else
03842             $found->attach($m);
03843           }
03844           else
03845           $found->attach($m);
03846         }
03847       }
03848     }
03849     $this->setMatches($found);
03850     return $this;
03851   }

03856   /**
03857    * Determine whether a given string looks like XML or not.
03858    *
03859    * Basically, this scans a portion of the supplied string, checking to see
03860    * if it has a tag-like structure. It is possible to "confuse" this, which
03861    * may subsequently result in parse errors, but in the vast majority of 
03862    * cases, this method serves as a valid inicator of whether or not the 
03863    * content looks like XML.
03864    *
03865    * Things that are intentional excluded:
03866    * - plain text with no markup.
03867    * - strings that look like filesystem paths.
03868    * 
03869    * Subclasses SHOULD NOT OVERRIDE THIS. Altering it may be altering
03870    * core assumptions about how things work. Instead, classes should 
03871    * override the constructor and pass in only one of the parsed types
03872    * that this class expects.
03873    */
03874   protected function isXMLish($string) {
03875     // Long strings will exhaust the regex engine, so we
03876     // grab a representative string.
03877     // $test = substr($string, 0, 255);
03878     return (strpos($string, '<') !== FALSE && strpos($string, '>') !== FALSE);
03879     //return preg_match(ML_EXP, $test) > 0;
03880   }
03881   
03882   private function parseXMLString($string, $flags = NULL) {
03883     
03884     $document = new DOMDocument('1.0');
03885     $lead = strtolower(substr($string, 0, 5)); // <?xml
03886     try {
03887       set_error_handler(array('QueryPathParseException', 'initializeFromError'), $this->errTypes);
03888       
03889       if (isset($this->options['convert_to_encoding'])) {
03890         // Is there another way to do this?
03891         
03892         $from_enc = isset($this->options['convert_from_encoding']) ? $this->options['convert_from_encoding'] : 'auto';
03893         $to_enc = $this->options['convert_to_encoding'];
03894         
03895         if (function_exists('mb_convert_encoding')) {
03896           $string = mb_convert_encoding($string, $to_enc, $from_enc);
03897         }
03898         
03899       }
03900       
03901       // This is to avoid cases where low ascii digits have slipped into HTML.
03902       // AFAIK, it should not adversly effect UTF-8 documents.
03903       if (!empty($this->options['strip_low_ascii'])) {
03904         $string = filter_var($string, FILTER_UNSAFE_RAW, FILTER_FLAG_ENCODE_LOW);
03905       }
03906       
03907       // Allow users to override parser settings.
03908       if (empty($this->options['use_parser'])) {
03909         $useParser = '';
03910       }
03911       else {
03912         $useParser = strtolower($this->options['use_parser']);
03913       }
03914       
03915       // If HTML parser is requested, we use it.
03916       if ($useParser == 'html') {
03917         $document->loadHTML($string);
03918       }
03919       // Parse as XML if it looks like XML, or if XML parser is requested.
03920       elseif ($lead == '<?xml' || $useParser == 'xml') {
03921         if ($this->options['replace_entities']) {
03922           $string = QueryPathEntities::replaceAllEntities($string);
03923         }
03924         $document->loadXML($string, $flags);
03925       }
03926       // In all other cases, we try the HTML parser.
03927       else {
03928         $document->loadHTML($string);
03929       }
03930     }
03931     // Emulate 'finally' behavior.
03932     catch (Exception $e) {
03933       restore_error_handler();
03934       throw $e;
03935     }
03936     restore_error_handler();
03937     
03938     if (empty($document)) {
03939       throw new QueryPathParseException('Unknown parser exception.');
03940     }
03941     return $document;
03942   }
03943   
03944   /**
03945    * EXPERT: Be very, very careful using this.
03946    * A utility function for setting the current set of matches.
03947    * It makes sure the last matches buffer is set (for end() and andSelf()).
03948    * @since 2.0
03949    */
03950   public function setMatches($matches, $unique = TRUE) {
03951     // This causes a lot of overhead....
03952     //if ($unique) $matches = self::unique($matches);
03953     $this->last = $this->matches;
03954     
03955     // Just set current matches.
03956     if ($matches instanceof SplObjectStorage) {
03957       $this->matches = $matches;
03958     }
03959     // This is likely legacy code that needs conversion.
03960     elseif (is_array($matches)) {
03961       trigger_error('Legacy array detected.');
03962       $tmp = new SplObjectStorage();
03963       foreach ($matches as $m) $tmp->attach($m);
03964       $this->matches = $tmp;
03965     }
03966     // For non-arrays, try to create a new match set and 
03967     // add this object.
03968     else {
03969       $found = new SplObjectStorage();
03970       if (isset($matches)) $found->attach($matches);
03971       $this->matches = $found;
03972     }
03973     
03974     // EXPERIMENTAL: Support for qp()->length.
03975     $this->length = $this->matches->count();
03976   }

03980    *
03981    * This preserves history.
03982    *
03983    * @since 2.0
03984    */
03985   private function noMatches() {
03986     $this->setMatches(NULL);
03987   }

03989   /**
03990    * A utility function for retriving a match by index.
03991    *
03992    * The internal data structure used in QueryPath does not have
03993    * strong random access support, so we suppliment it with this method.
03994    */
03995   private function getNthMatch($index) {
03996     if ($index > $this->matches->count() || $index < 0) return;
03997     
03998     $i = 0;
03999     foreach ($this->matches as $m) {
04000       if ($i++ == $index) return $m;
04001     }
04002   }
04003   
04004   /**
04005    * Convenience function for getNthMatch(0).
04006    */
04007   private function getFirstMatch() {
04008     $this->matches->rewind();
04009     return $this->matches->current();
04010   }

04028   /**
04029    * Parse an XML or HTML file.
04030    *
04031    * This attempts to autodetect the type of file, and then parse it.
04032    *
04033    * @param string $filename
04034    *  The file name to parse.
04035    * @param int $flags
04036    *  The OR-combined flags accepted by the DOM parser. See the PHP documentation
04037    *  for DOM or for libxml.
04038    * @param resource $context
04039    *  The stream context for the file IO. If this is set, then an alternate 
04040    *  parsing path is followed: The file is loaded by PHP's stream-aware IO
04041    *  facilities, read entirely into memory, and then handed off to 
04042    *  {@link parseXMLString()}. On large files, this can have a performance impact.
04043    * @throws QueryPathParseException 
04044    *  Thrown when a file cannot be loaded or parsed.
04045    */
04046   private function parseXMLFile($filename, $flags = NULL, $context = NULL) {
04047     
04048     // If a context is specified, we basically have to do the reading in 
04049     // two steps:
04050     if (!empty($context)) {
04051       try {
04052         set_error_handler(array('QueryPathParseException', 'initializeFromError'), $this->errTypes);
04053         $contents = file_get_contents($filename, FALSE, $context);
04054         
04055       }
04056       // Apparently there is no 'finally' in PHP, so we have to restore the error
04057       // handler this way:
04058       catch(Exception $e) {
04059         restore_error_handler();
04060         throw $e;
04061       }
04062       restore_error_handler();
04063       
04064       if ($contents == FALSE) {
04065         throw new QueryPathParseException(sprintf('Contents of the file %s could not be retrieved.', $filename));
04066       }
04067       
04068       
04069       /* This is basically unneccessary overhead, as it is not more
04070        * accurate than the existing method.
04071       if (isset($md['wrapper_type']) &&  $md['wrapper_type'] == 'http') {
04072         for ($i = 0; $i < count($md['wrapper_data']); ++$i) {
04073           if (stripos($md['wrapper_data'][$i], 'content-type:') !== FALSE) {
04074             $ct = trim(substr($md['wrapper_data'][$i], 12));
04075             if (stripos('text/html') === 0) {
04076               $this->parseXMLString($contents, $flags, 'text/html');
04077             }
04078             else {
04079               // We can't account for all of the mime types that have
04080               // an XML payload, so we set it to XML.
04081               $this->parseXMLString($contents, $flags, 'text/xml');
04082             }
04083             break;
04084           }
04085         }
04086       }
04087       */
04088       
04089       return $this->parseXMLString($contents, $flags);
04090     }
04091     
04092     $document = new DOMDocument();
04093     $lastDot = strrpos($filename, '.');
04094     
04095     $htmlExtensions = array(
04096       '.html' => 1,
04097       '.htm' => 1,
04098     );
04099     
04100     // Allow users to override parser settings.
04101     if (empty($this->options['use_parser'])) {
04102       $useParser = '';
04103     }
04104     else {
04105       $useParser = strtolower($this->options['use_parser']);
04106     }
04107     
04108     $ext = $lastDot !== FALSE ? strtolower(substr($filename, $lastDot)) : '';
04109     
04110     try {
04111       set_error_handler(array('QueryPathParseException', 'initializeFromError'), $this->errTypes);
04112       
04113       // If the parser is explicitly set to XML, use that parser.
04114       if ($useParser == 'xml') {
04115         $r = $document->load($filename, $flags);
04116       }
04117       // Otherwise, see if it looks like HTML.
04118       elseif (isset($htmlExtensions[$ext]) || $useParser == 'html') {
04119         // Try parsing it as HTML.
04120         $r = $document->loadHTMLFile($filename);
04121       }
04122       // Default to XML.
04123       else {
04124         $r = $document->load($filename, $flags);
04125       }
04126       
04127     }
04128     // Emulate 'finally' behavior.
04129     catch (Exception $e) {
04130       restore_error_handler();
04131       throw $e;
04132     }
04133     restore_error_handler();
04134     
04135     
04136     
04137     /*
04138     if ($r == FALSE) {
04139       $fmt = 'Failed to load file %s: %s (%s, %s)';
04140       $err = error_get_last();
04141       if ($err['type'] & self::IGNORE_ERRORS) {
04142         // Need to report these somehow...
04143         trigger_error($err['message'], E_USER_WARNING);
04144       }
04145       else {
04146         throw new QueryPathParseException(sprintf($fmt, $filename, $err['message'], $err['file'], $err['line']));
04147       }
04148       
04149       //throw new QueryPathParseException(sprintf($fmt, $filename, $err['message'], $err['file'], $err['line']));
04150     }
04151     */
04152     return $document;
04153   }

04155   /**
04156    * Call extension methods.
04157    *
04158    * This function is used to invoke extension methods. It searches the
04159    * registered extenstensions for a matching function name. If one is found,
04160    * it is executed with the arguments in the $arguments array.
04161    * 
04162    * @throws QueryPathException
04163    *  An exception is thrown if a non-existent method is called.
04164    */
04165   public function __call($name, $arguments) {
04166     
04167     if (!QueryPathExtensionRegistry::$useRegistry) {
04168       throw new QueryPathException("No method named $name found (Extensions disabled).");      
04169     }
04170     
04171     // Loading of extensions is deferred until the first time a
04172     // non-core method is called. This makes constructing faster, but it
04173     // may make the first invocation of __call() slower (if there are 
04174     // enough extensions.)
04175     //
04176     // The main reason for moving this out of the constructor is that most
04177     // new QueryPath instances do not use extensions. Charging qp() calls
04178     // with the additional hit is not a good idea.
04179     //
04180     // Also, this will at least limit the number of circular references.
04181     if (empty($this->ext)) {
04182       // Load the registry
04183       $this->ext = QueryPathExtensionRegistry::getExtensions($this);
04184     }
04185     
04186     // Note that an empty ext registry indicates that extensions are disabled.
04187     if (!empty($this->ext) && QueryPathExtensionRegistry::hasMethod($name)) {
04188       $owner = QueryPathExtensionRegistry::getMethodClass($name);
04189       $method = new ReflectionMethod($owner, $name);
04190       return $method->invokeArgs($this->ext[$owner], $arguments);
04191     }
04192     throw new QueryPathException("No method named $name found. Possibly missing an extension.");
04193   }

04209       default:

04211     }
04212   }
04213   */

04219    */
04220   public function getIterator() {

04227 /**
04228  * Perform various tasks on HTML/XML entities.
04229  *
04230  * @ingroup querypath_util
04231  */
04232 class QueryPathEntities {
04233   
04234   /**
04235    * This is three regexes wrapped into 1. The | divides them.
04236    * 1: Match any char-based entity. This will go in $matches[1]
04237    * 2: Match any num-based entity. This will go in $matches[2]
04238    * 3: Match any hex-based entry. This will go in $matches[3]
04239    * 4: Match any ampersand that is not an entity. This goes in $matches[4]
04240    *    This last rule will only match if one of the previous two has not already
04241    *    matched.
04242    * XXX: Are octal encodings for entities acceptable?
04243    */
04244   //protected static $regex = '/&([\w]+);|&#([\d]+);|&([\w]*[\s$]+)/m';
04245   protected static $regex = '/&([\w]+);|&#([\d]+);|&#(x[0-9a-fA-F]+);|(&)/m';
04246   
04247   /**
04248    * Replace all entities.
04249    * This will scan a string and will attempt to replace all
04250    * entities with their numeric equivalent. This will not work
04251    * with specialized entities.
04252    *
04253    * @param string $string
04254    *  The string to perform replacements on.
04255    * @return string
04256    *  Returns a string that is similar to the original one, but with 
04257    *  all entity replacements made.
04258    */
04259   public static function replaceAllEntities($string) {
04260     return preg_replace_callback(self::$regex, 'QueryPathEntities::doReplacement', $string);
04261   }
04262   
04263   /**
04264    * Callback for processing replacements.
04265    *
04266    * @param array $matches
04267    *  The regular expression replacement array.
04268    */
04269   protected static function doReplacement($matches) {
04270     // See how the regex above works out.
04271     //print_r($matches);
04272 
04273     // From count, we can tell whether we got a 
04274     // char, num, or bare ampersand.
04275     $count = count($matches);
04276     switch ($count) {
04277       case 2:
04278         // We have a character entity
04279         return '&#' . self::replaceEntity($matches[1]) . ';';
04280       case 3:
04281       case 4:
04282         // we have a numeric entity
04283         return '&#' . $matches[$count-1] . ';'; 
04284       case 5:
04285         // We have an unescaped ampersand.
04286         return '&#38;';
04287     }
04288   }
04289   
04290   /**
04291    * Lookup an entity string's numeric equivalent.
04292    *
04293    * @param string $entity
04294    *  The entity whose numeric value is needed.
04295    * @return int
04296    *  The integer value corresponding to the entity.
04297    * @author Matt Butcher
04298    * @author Ryan Mahoney
04299    */
04300   public static function replaceEntity($entity) {
04301     return self::$entity_array[$entity];
04302   }

04380 /**
04381  * An iterator for QueryPath.
04382  *
04383  * This provides iterator support for QueryPath. You do not need to construct
04384  * a QueryPathIterator. QueryPath does this when its {@link QueryPath::getIterator()}
04385  * method is called.
04386  *
04387  * @ingroup querypath_util
04388  */
04389 class QueryPathIterator extends IteratorIterator {
04390   public $options = array();
04391   private $qp = NULL;
04392   
04393   public function current() {
04394     if (!isset($this->qp)) {
04395       $this->qp = qp(parent::current(), NULL, $this->options);
04396     }
04397     else {
04398       $splos = new SplObjectStorage();
04399       $splos->attach(parent::current());
04400       $this->qp->setMatches($splos);
04401     }
04402     return $this->qp;
04403   }
04404 }

04406 /**
04407  * Manage default options.
04408  *
04409  * This class stores the default options for QueryPath. When a new 
04410  * QueryPath object is constructed, options specified here will be 
04411  * used.
04412  *
04413  * <b>Details</b>
04414  * This class defines no options of its own. Instead, it provides a 
04415  * central tool for developers to override options set by QueryPath.
04416  * When a QueryPath object is created, it will evaluate options in the 
04417  * following order:
04418  *
04419  * - Options passed into {@link qp()} have highest priority.
04420  * - Options in {@link QueryPathOptions} (this class) have the next highest priority.
04421  * - If the option is not specified elsewhere, QueryPath will use its own defaults.
04422  *
04423  * @see qp()
04424  * @see QueryPathOptions::set()
04425  * @ingroup querypath_util
04426  */
04427 class QueryPathOptions {
04428   
04429   /**
04430    * This is the static options array.
04431    *
04432    * Use the {@link set()}, {@link get()}, and {@link merge()} to
04433    * modify this array.
04434    */
04435   static $options = array();
04436   
04437   /**
04438    * Set the default options.
04439    *
04440    * The passed-in array will be used as the default options list.
04441    *
04442    * @param array $array
04443    *  An associative array of options.
04444    */
04445   static function set($array) {
04446     self::$options = $array;
04447   }
04448   
04449   /**
04450    * Get the default options.
04451    *
04452    * Get all options currently set as default.
04453    *
04454    * @return array
04455    *  An array of options. Note that only explicitly set options are 
04456    *  returned. {@link QueryPath} defines default options which are not
04457    *  stored in this object.
04458    */
04459   static function get() {
04460     return self::$options;
04461   }
04462   
04463   /**
04464    * Merge the provided array with existing options.
04465    *
04466    * On duplicate keys, the value in $array will overwrite the 
04467    * value stored in the options.
04468    *
04469    * @param array $array
04470    *  Associative array of options to merge into the existing options.
04471    */
04472   static function merge($array) {
04473     self::$options = $array + self::$options;
04474   }
04475   
04476   /**
04477    * Returns true of the specified key is already overridden in this object.
04478    *
04479    * @param string $key
04480    *  The key to search for.
04481    */
04482   static function has($key) {
04483     return array_key_exists($key, self::$options);
04484   }
04485   
04486 }

04495 /**
04496  * Exception indicating that a parser has failed to parse a file.
04497  *
04498  * This will report parser warnings as well as parser errors. It should only be 
04499  * thrown, though, under error conditions.
04500  *
04501  * @ingroup querypath_core
04502  */
04503 class QueryPathParseException extends QueryPathException {
04504   const ERR_MSG_FORMAT = 'Parse error in %s on line %d column %d: %s (%d)';
04505   const WARN_MSG_FORMAT = 'Parser warning in %s on line %d column %d: %s (%d)';
04506   // trigger_error
04507   public function __construct($msg = '', $code = 0, $file = NULL, $line = NULL) {
04508 
04509     $msgs = array();
04510     foreach(libxml_get_errors() as $err) {
04511       $format = $err->level == LIBXML_ERR_WARNING ? self::WARN_MSG_FORMAT : self::ERR_MSG_FORMAT;
04512       $msgs[] = sprintf($format, $err->file, $err->line, $err->column, $err->message, $err->code);
04513     }
04514     $msg .= implode("\n", $msgs);
04515     
04516     if (isset($file)) {
04517       $msg .= ' (' . $file;
04518       if (isset($line)) $msg .= ': ' . $line;
04519       $msg .= ')';
04520     }
04521     
04522     parent::__construct($msg, $code);
04523   }
04524   
04525   public static function initializeFromError($code, $str, $file, $line, $cxt) {
04526     //printf("\n\nCODE: %s %s\n\n", $code, $str);
04527     $class = __CLASS__;
04528     throw new $class($str, $code, $file, $line);
04529   }
04530 }
